Reviews.Title: “Quick business trip”
Reviews.Author: CalGat
Reviews.Content: Was here for one night for a quick business trip. I stayed in a king bed room. The room was clean and had a decent amount of space. Free wifi. For a night or two I would stay here again. Negatives: The bed was too firm for my taste, the contactors for the A/C were loud when coming on. The ugly: we had a banquet dinner at the in-house restaurant. Worst steak of my life, so don't eat here. The dessert was tasty thought. There are several other food options nearby. The weird: There are rooms with a balcony that face the indoor pool. My female coworker found it creepy. But I guess if your kids were swimming in the pool it would be a good way to keep an eye on them. Overall good value for the money, fine for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean property centrally located in North Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: KevandKaren
Reviews.Content: I am a local but stayed here one-night to save myself a drive back up to North Phoenix the next morning. It is a very clean, conveniently located hotel. It had an indoor and outdoor pool area, a nice restaurant for breakfast, and WiFi. I chose this hotel because I received a great corporate rate and it was slightly better than most overnight business trip hotels I stay at. The only downside I would comment on my trip was the $4 pint beers in the empty bar. Probably why the bar was empty, but that's not a huge detraction for me anyway. Overall, nice place to stage from in PHX.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jocko95
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights in mid march, perfect place to use as a base while staying in Phoenix, Clean room, good food, and great staff. The maid service was outstanding. We asked at the front desk for extra coffee for our room and by the time we got to our room there was someone waiting with with it at our door. I dont understand some of the complaints about this property because we never had any issues whatsoever

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience...”
Reviews.Author: Filmguy5
Reviews.Content: Save your time and money on this hotel, Its so out-dated. We checked in and i honestly saw 30 people in the lobby just partying it up like no tomorrow and drinking as if it was a backyard party...REALLY. i did not feel safe here and i told the front desk and said he would take care of it and sure enough it was an every night thing...All hotel just wants is your money!!! look at the pictures i have attached to see what you are paying for...if you want a room that the AC doesnt work and walls cracked, rusty plumbing and a pleasant welcome by a ton of gangsters in the lobby with 40 ounce bottles... then come on down and waist your money...ugh. Also when i complained abouit these issues and they said we just completed a 4 million dollar renovation. REALLY.....

Reviews.Title: “Good choice when in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinRanger
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times while on business. Have never been disappointed. Hotel is a little older but kept in very good condition. Is very clean. Staff has always treated me very well. I have had road side, freeway side and this time a pool side room on an upper floor. I have not noticed outside noise. You do hear some noise from the pool activity but that seems to cease right a 10:00 p.m. Breakfast (charge) provides an excellent variety of well prepared fare. Location is within easy walk or drive to various shopping, restaurant and entertainment venues.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated, good value, spotty operations”
Reviews.Author: LanSluderBelize
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Crowne Plaza in North Phoenix, and it was better than I expected. I'm a Hilton chain fan, and don't think this Holiday Inn chain product is up to Hilton chain standards, but we had two rooms for five nights for just 50,000 Priority Club points (a Points Stretcher deal), which is hard to beat, considering that even Hampton Inn rooms in Phoenix in March run $175+. On the plus side, the hotel recently has been renovated, and rooms, while not fancy, are pleasant enough. There's plenty of free parking, and while this Crowne Plaza really isn't near anything it's just a half hour from nearly everything in the Valley. On the negative side, rooms have no fridge or microwave. You can rent a fridge for $10 a day -- c'mon, when was the last time you rented a fridge, unless you were staying at a $39 a night mom 'n pop!? This is ridiculous! Housekeeping also was hit and miss. Some days we got soap and washcloths, and other days we didn't. All of our three rooms (friends joined us for a couple of days) faced the interior pool, so there was no natural light. We had breakfast at the hotel ($7 to $11 each for the continental or full buffet ) a couple of days, and it was so-so. I did like the Starbucks kiosk -- Priority members get free coupons. The bar/lounge -- 99 Degrees -- is like something out of the 1950s. All in all, it could have been much worse, but it still has a long way to go to compete with other similar chain properties. But for free, I can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tina P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 ningts at the end of February. 2 pools and 2 hot tubs indoor and outdoor, which was nice. Rooms were decent size and comfortable beds. Bathroom was small but manageable. Fridge in the room . Didn't use the restraunt but did visit lounge twice and it was fine. Front desk was helpful and friendly . Never failed to say hi or good morning when passing by. Location is good for food or shopping as you just head west on Peoria st and many choices less than a mile away. Overall clean and comfortable hotel. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: HomebodyTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before flying out from Phoenix, so it was very much a quick stopover where we weren't looking for a ton of amenities, just a clean room. Crowne Plaza delivered on that score; and we got a nice rate via Hotwire. Rooms are arranged a very large atrium which includes an indoor pool. It didn't bother us at all, but guests who are sensitive to chlorine odors might find this a drawback. The hotel seemed nice but strangely empty of decor. I think we may have come while they were in the midst of a carpet cleaning of the main atrium--no furniture, no plants in the gravel, just wide open emptiness, which gave it a strange feel. The front desk staff were generally nice, but on check-on the clerk failed to notify us that there was a happy hour. We learned of it only after we were walking through the lobby and heard another staffer apologize to a guest that he was checking in too late to be a part of it. I wasn't sure if this was because we were Hotwire guests, or plain forgetfulness, but we were disappointed with that. If they had breakfast we didn't hear about that either! The indoor pool was bitterly cold--we had no problem coaxing my son out of it because he was turning blue. Hotel is in the midst of a corporate park area; there are some restaurants & shopping nearby (driving distance) but nothing you could walk to. The front desk staff have a list of local restaurants they will share. That's helpful. Cute gift shop in hotel, small but some worthwhile items. Hotel is in North Phoenix area, right off Interstate 17, so it's a quick jaunt to downtown, airport, etc. I would stay here again for a trip of this purpose--just a place to crash for a night while we were in transit.

Reviews.Title: “Scary”
Reviews.Author: Ed U
Reviews.Content: Our soccer team stayed at the Crowne Plaza and it was scary. Frist night one of our team mates car got broken into. Everything was stolen from there car. Second night we were woken at 3am by people out side our room outside. Know one came and told them to go to there rooms So at 330am I had to call the front desk to get them out of there. Would never stay there again. Toooooo Scary Not Safe

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay for Soccer Team”
Reviews.Author: tracy r
Reviews.Content: Our U16 Girls Soccer Team recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Phoenix. With the help of Tiffany our stay was wonderful. Check in was quick and easy, breakfast was great, the rooms were quite and roomy. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pig with lipstick”
Reviews.Author: texasgolfer31
Reviews.Content: This is a classic example of hotel mis-branding. No way is this a Crowne Plaza. At best it’s a Holiday Inn with a few superficial upgrades, but even then it still needs some work. Everything has a down-market feel – the rooms, the lobby, the staff, the pool, the guests (large group of Hispanics sitting in lobby talking very loudly wearing tank tops and drinking from a couple of brought-in cases of beer). Good value, though, since the room only cost $53 through Hotwire. But it’s still a pig with lipstick.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: zracoon
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better three star hotels I've stayed at. It seems very recently renovated with really nice decor. The service was very friendly and welcoming. It was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities - Very happy!”
Reviews.Author: Carmen C
Reviews.Content: I chose the Crowne Plaza to home my parents while they are "snow birding" in Arizona. I met up with them and I was very impressed with the facilities and the excellent service we received. All the staff was very friendly and so helpful. We enjoyed a delicious full buffet breakfast every morning. This hotel has a full service restaurant, indoor and outdoor heated pools and hot tubs, use of the internet, and shuttle service within a five mile radius. This was so great as we did not have to rent a car. We had a beautiful view of the outdoor pool from our window and well as a nice view of the indoor pool just outside our door. Our room was really nice, clean , came with a fridge and we had a big bathroom and long counter top, hair blower and close up mirror to put on your make up. I would like to thank Megan in the travel sales department for all her help and all the nice staff for being so good to my parents.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle H
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very accommodating, well kept up, and the staff was very nice. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “always great but no customer services response :(”
Reviews.Author: aniduran
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the valley but usually take a trip once or twice a month for a fun weekend and always stay at this Crowne Plaza. It really is a great hotel. Good location, really nicely decorated, and impeccably clean with a great pool and restaurant. During our most recent stay, we forgot our swimsuits and went to buy a new one so we only made it about 10 minutes before the hot tub closed. The security guard came about 3 minutes later and told us we had to leave. My 4 year old daughter asked very nicely if she could stay for a few minutes and he snapped at her and said no, we needed to leave now. As if we were some problem causers when we were quiet and letting our kid have a little fun and we spend probably 200 a month here. The lady at the front desk was very apologetic and offered us free breakfast but we had to work and couldn't accept it. She is always great when we check in. I wrote to corporate though because it was a rare experience and I hate to see that happen at such a great place but I never got a response which was extremely disappointing. I was expecting at least a thanks for letting us know, but nothing. We plan to stay there tomorrow for Christmas Eve and Christmas and will continue to go, I just hate to be such a good customer and literally be a little humiliated by some security guard. He made my daughter and I cry.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night at the Crowne Plaza and found the experience to be very good indeed. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was clean and provided what we needed. We ate in the hotel restaurant for dinner and were very surprised at the great meal. The food was not only very good, but the service was excellent. The morning breakfast buffet was good, though nothing exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “The Crowne is a Jewel”
Reviews.Author: Tariance
Reviews.Content: You will want to make a point to stay at the Crowne Plaza Phoenix North when you are in the Phoenix area or wish to schedule a nice getaway at a reasonable price. I had the opportunity to spend two nights at the Crowne Plaza recently where I toured the facility in order to evaluate the property for a proposed event for my hobby group in 2014. My first impression was good, the hotel property is easily accessible from Interstate 17 just across from the Metro Center Mall. The exterior of the Crowne Plaza is bold-colored stucco, clean geometrical design with a nicely maintained parking lot. Parking was plentiful and convenient to any side of the building with a number of entrances and exits all under key control. The Lobby was large and inviting. Modern southwest decor greeted me as did a friendly desk clerk. Check in was a breeze and I was able to quickly make my way to a 3rd floor room overlooking the indoor pool at the entrance and overlooking the outdoor pool on the opposite balcony side. The room was a double/double, basically a standard sized hotel room. Take a look at the video I prepared detailing my tour of the hotel. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xcgzsUiUBKQ&feature=youtube_gdata_player I had the opportunity to observe the hotel staff and I could not be more impressed. I have not seen this level of customer service demonstrated since staying at a much pricier 4 or 5 star hotel. My room came with a certificate for a drink from the Starbucks kiosk. The kiosk was staffed by the breakfast servers attending to the very fresh, well done breakfast buffet. The server-barista was pleasant, prompt, and provided me with a totally tasty latte. The staff was friendly without being 'forced', they made eye contact, and made you feel totally welcomed. The breakfast consisted of continental fare which was a selection of fresh fruit (whole and cut), rolls, danish, bagels, toast, yogurt, juice, water, coffee. You had the option of upgrading breakfast to the hot buffet which added a selection of breakfast meats, skillet potatoes, eggs, waffles, and fresh salsas. I opted for the upgrade and was not disappointed. The dishes were fresh, hot, and plentiful. The servers kept your coffee cup full and cleared the tables promptly. There were a large number of guests at the hotel as two college teams were in town for bowl/invitationals. The hotel was properly staffed to take care of the needs of large groups as well as the singles there for a quick bite before taking in events, shopping, and the sites of Phoenix. The hotel offers the best in resort offerings: indoor & outdoor pools, spa, fully equipped gym, lounge, restaurant, lovely grounds and great proximity to nightlife and shopping. The Crowne Plaza Phoenix North is a surprise in that it feels as if you were one of just a few guests in a bed & breakfast. I would highly recommend this property for couples, a girls weekend away, or a corporate or hobby event. I whole-heartedly recommended the Crowne Plaza to my group and hope to have a week long event there in the spring of 2014. The Crowne Plaza Phoenix North is a jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Busy but friendly”
Reviews.Author: family_guy_98101
Reviews.Content: This place was packed with a lot of sports teams, but the staff still took care of us well. I was surprised at how quiet the rooms were for the number of kids using the indoor atrium pool.

Reviews.Title: “Circa 1970's Retro - Not in a Hip Way”
Reviews.Author: 50isthenew40
Reviews.Content: Two nights at this Hwy 17 adjacent hotel. Booked as part of a Southwest Airlines package - air, room and car. The old saying applies - you get what you pay for. Out here for a soccer tournament and to visit a few friends. Pros: good wireless internet, strong shower water pressure, 30 " LG TV Cons: old and tired bathrooms, noisy road noise (thin glass dosn't provide much insulation), noisy AC (cycled on/off througout night). Ironic? Lot's of room propoganda regarding the hotel's committment to 'green' and conservation. However, to get to your bath towel you need to disrupt all the creatively folded hand towels and wash cloths. I doubt the housekeeping staff can discern whether the disrupted hand towel was actually used or simply moved to access the bath towel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Facility”
Reviews.Author: Shirley M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and did not have one complaint. Rooms were great, beds were super, AND the towels were high quality (not often found in hotels anymore). We were impressed with the staff being very helpful in all areas. Inside and outside pools looked very inviting. We would stay here again in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel...very impressed”
Reviews.Author: AnotherGatorFan
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff....beautiful lobby - indoor pool with waterfall - indside the hotel is very clean and spacious. Outdoor pool was nice also. The room was very nice and very clean. The bed was very comfortable and we had a new flat screen tv - we asked for an inside room since the hotel is right next to the freeway...which they gave us without a problem. We will definately stay there again if we are ever in the Phoenix area again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: momoftwoBrentwood
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and while the staff is usually most accomodating, the facilities have slowly changed from marginal to well below the standard of the Crowne Plaza Brand and represents itself more as a upscale Motel 6 rather than a full service upscale hotel. The only upside is that the indoor pool is finally reopened after months of closure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bruce L
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at a hotel where the staff was friendlier! Everyone greeted us and went out of there way to make our stay a quality experience. The room was clean and well appointed. The air conditioner worked well (Phoenix in August!) and the bed was very comfortable. The pool and the area around it was clean and inviting. The location is just off Hwy 17 so you are freeway close. If your room is on the freeway side there is a little noise but we did not find it disruptive. The breakfast buffet is not world class gourmet but it is very good. I would be happy to return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: carolina46
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 3am after flight delays from the UK. The room was large with a balcony overlooking the lovely pool area. Very clean and comfortable and at $63 for the 3 of us it was very good value. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tlousley
Reviews.Content: I'm always a little leary when booking hotels, however this time I was not disappointed. I asked for a quiet room since this hotel is next to the freeway. I was put in a row of rooms called the "Quiet Zone" and did not hear a peep the entire stay....not from neighbors or the freeway. The room had two queen size beds and a large bathroom. Everything was immaculate. Ate their buffet breakfast one day that was very good @ $25 for two people. Very trendy looking hotel. I was there on business to photograph a model and they even let me photograph her throughout their facility. I read on one of the other reviews that wireless internet was not available in the rooms, however this is FALSE. I worked from my room every evening. Close to lots of shopping and restaurants. Great place to stay and will stay there again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snowgirl62
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I had reservations at a resort and spa but needed a place to stay for a few extra days before checking into our resort. This was a great value (package deal with airfare ended up making the hotel about $60 per night) but not at all what I have come to expect from Crown Plaza. The room was decent size, comfortable beds, and decent clean bathroom. However, that's about the best I can say overall. There was a goldfish cracker that was in our room during our entire stay, leading us to believe that our floor was never vacuumed throughout the 4 days we were there (and also, since it was there when we checked in, that it wasn't vacuumed after the prior guest checked out). We stayed here in July, which is typically very slow and there were maybe 10 guests othere than us here during our entire stay. The indoor pool was closed for renovations, so that put us in the outdoor (which was ok - we wanted to be in the sun!) The only downfall is that the outdoor pool was very dirty every day. There was a dust storm during our stay, but even prior there were bugs and leaves in the pool. I'm not sure it was ever vacuumed (hmmm..running theme??). There was a great courtesy shuttle that ran in a 5 mile radius from the hotel, and both our shuttle drivers were great - offering suggestions for meals, giving us some insight into the city, etc. The biggest complaint for the shuttle - it is adverteised as 7 am to 10 pm, but every day we were there, it was closed from 1 pm to 4 pm which makes getting someplace for lunch very difficult when you have no car. Overall, this was an ok hotel - nothing great, but if you need a clean bed and shower, it will work.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff rude need to learn customer service.”
Reviews.Author: sasha079
Reviews.Content: This was a one night stay over at a hotel staffed by rude front desk employees. Considering how empty the place was you would think they would appreciate custom. The renovations are still underway so forget about the pool etc. They are a long way from the supposed close restaurants. The location map they give you is a work of fiction. The only pleasant staff they had were the ladies serving the dreadful overbooked breakfast that we finally abandoned.

Reviews.Title: “My Phoenix Home”
Reviews.Author: mwatje
Reviews.Content: I travel to Phoenix for business close to every other week. And when I go there, I only stay at this Crowne Plaza. It's hard to find places that are so consistently clean, helpful, and comfortable-- and at such a good value. After countless stays here, I can say they are more consistent in their service than nearly any other hotel I visit. Unlike what you read on other posts, the hotel IS QUIET unless you are located on the outer side of the hotel facing the freeway. Regardless, each room comes with a care package with an eye mask and ear plugs. Use them. The beds, linens, and towels are always clean and relatively new. The beds are all comfortable, as are the pillows. Just what you expect from Crowne Plaza and Holiday Inn family hotels. The front desk staff is always very helpful. If something's not right or needs attention, they get it done for you very quickly. The bartender helps make lonely nights enjoyable and is a great entertainer. Saturday nights are very busy in the bar, otherwise you can get very quick service on any other night. The food does take a while, but it is worth it. The new chef is very good and I haven't had a bad item from the menu yet. If you want something really nice, Pappadeaux is a block away. If you need something healthy, there is a Sweet Tomato's and a Souper Salad within a two block radius. The Crowne Plaza on Peoria Avenue really makes my travels a lot more convenient, enjoyable, and less draining. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL!!! Perfect location and STAFF!!”
Reviews.Author: marijke222
Reviews.Content: We had a four day trip to Phoenix. This hotel is located right off 17. Staff was incredible with helpful hints. Nice amenities. Awesome breakfast buffet. Thanks Consuela!! You are an amazing waitress! We will miss you and the coffee. Great bargain and nice pool. Lovely lobby, free computers with printers, did I mention the staff was awesome. Perfectly located for everything you want to do. Scottsdale, Flagstaff, Sedona, Heart Museum, North Mountain, Desert Botanical Gardens, Grand Canyon, 15 minutes from the airport. Grocery shopping is 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “A Regular”
Reviews.Author: CactusPatch
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Crowne Plaza Phoenix (Metro Center) for years. The full service is great, the variety of spaces makes it a great place to hang out. They continue to remodel and upgrade to keep the place new. Staff is always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Too loud”
Reviews.Author: Hoponabike
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending some spring training games. The hotel is set up where some rooms do not have a window to the outside. This means that you have a hallway on one side of your room and a large sliding glass door on the other. The result of this is too much noise all night long. There was an incident when the front desk gave someone else keys to our room, and they walked in while we were resting. The matter was handled with promptly and we were given breakfast vouchers for their error.

Reviews.Title: “two more great stays”
Reviews.Author: 35805Diane
Reviews.Content: Two more great stays at Crowne Plaza. Our cross country travels took us to the Crowne TPlaza Phoenix---I-17 and Peoria and the Crowne Plaza Hollywood Beach. Treatment at both is wonderful and keeps us returning and returning and returning. Tried other hotel brands in both locals before finding our "homes" at Crowne Plaza. None of the others provided the service or value of these two Crowne Plazas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: hermantui
Reviews.Content: Our Church, The First Samoan Congregational Christian Church of AZ, UCC, celebrated our 10 year anniversary in the Grand Ballroom and rate the staff, service and food all excellent. Thanks to Rachelle and the catering department, the chef and ballroom helpers and the whole staff at Crowne Plaza Phoenix for making our occasion very memorable in every aspect of service that was provided. God Bless you all and looking forward to working with you all again in the future. Herman F. Tuiteleleapaga Moderator

Reviews.Title: “Exellent value”
Reviews.Author: jumblies
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on a special for a weekend conference with some trepidation after reading reviews here. The experience was very different from what I had read in reviews. Points of contention with reviews: 1. Renovation is complete. Carpet smell gone. 2. Neighborhood: Not sketchy, just not Scottsdale. 3. Nice rooms with all the usual crown plaza amenities. Pro: 1. Breakfast was pretty good. NIce array. Tasty. Healthy as you want it to be. 2. Very convenient location off I-17. Can't stress this enough. 3. Low occupancy means very attentive staff 4. Free internet (see below). 5. Gym Equipment old, but all functional. Smith press for free weights which is uncommon and. Con: 1. Free internet capped at slower than a 56k modem. Speed tests yielded a 37K cap. If you need to download a presentation, expect to do it overnight. Even pandora choked. 2. Neighborhood is a typical for interstate located hotels. In defense the parking lot was patrolled and nothing ill happened while I was there. 3. Indoor pool currently not open.

Reviews.Title: “Great group stay”
Reviews.Author: fonz1507
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property for 2 weeks the last couple of years with very large groups. The hotel staff has always been extremely accommodating and very friendly, while adjusting to our last minute needs. The rooms were recently updated and were very comfortable and clean, definitely the best bang for your buck!I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in a large or small group in the area. The only thing it lacks is a up to date fitness center, but there is a 24 hour fitness just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, friendly/helpful staff, good weekend”
Reviews.Author: justducky_11
Reviews.Content: We were in Arizona for the BCS Championship game and reserved a few rooms at this hotel. The location of the hotel is good as it is right off the freeway and you can get anywhere you need fairly quickly. The hotel staff was very helpful and very nice. We got a really great rate here compared to many other places at this busy time and really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best accpommodations we've had for USFHA Festival”
Reviews.Author: The_Aussie_Bob
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all we needed after a day's work, umpiring (field) hockey - pool, spa, nearby restaurants and hotel was with a 20 minute drive from the Sports Centre. It's by far the best accommodation we umpires have had!!

Reviews.Title: “"Great stay for the value"”
Reviews.Author: wannabpirate
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience at the Crowne Plaza Phoenix. The room was very clean, the bathroom was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. Good restaurant downstairs and the entire staff were accommodating. I stayed at the hotel for a meeting and the meeting space was ample and the parking was free. This hotel is easily accessible and conveniently located and had several restaurants near by. The stay was great and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and service was great - hotel undergoing renovations”
Reviews.Author: tfhcoach
Reviews.Content: Staff went out of their way to accomodate our group needs for the rooms and meeting room. Exceptional service!. These people are wonderful and friendly. The hotel is little dated but is undergoing renovations and should be fine once it is completed. Stay there and support the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: CougOlympia_WA
Reviews.Content: In town for a large event and was looking forward to a four night stay that turned into what's going to be wrong next. 3 months advance reservation and couldn't get the bed we reserved and confirmed. Trash and dirty glasses left outside our room on the floor. Dirty glasses were left in the room and they didn't even empty out the ice bucket or clean under and around it. I felt the breakfast buffet was misrepresented. The hotel was clean and it looks nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience yet!!!”
Reviews.Author: tepcro
Reviews.Content: I noticed on check in that all the ground floor rooms had been gutted out. This hotel pretty much looked like it was a worn out old has been hotel, however they were rebuilding it on the inside. The brand new carpet on the 2nd floor hallway and rooms was giving off so much gas (new carpet smell) that it burned my eyes after a while and I woke up with a sore throat that went away after breathing some good old fresh air. BTW the headache wasn't too good either. I thought I'd get out of the room and get some air and found that the inside pool and spa was out of service. Went to the outside pool only to find the spa was lukewarm and the jets didn't work!!!! All this said, the bed was really comfortable!!! Too bad I couldn't sleep because of the carpet smell and the A/C being so noisy, it woke me every time it stopped and started. The room was really nice and it appeared that all the rooms had a poolside patio door and private balcony overlooking the inside pool. Maybe when they get done with the remodel and air out the carpet for a while this hotel will be all it looks like they are trying to make it!? This property has 2 pools and spas 1 inside and 1 outside. The neighborhood is somewhat seedy in that it apears to be older and rundown. The staff seemed to be really eagar to help but I found it odd that they didn't know that the spa was cold and didn't work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: wallydog66
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and courteous. Pet friendly; lovely lawn area in back. We traveled with our dog. Both pools were well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat at the restaurant you'll die of old age waiting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fuzzumsuk
Reviews.Content: We were placed here by the airline to wait out the Volcano in Iceland.I have never stayed at a Crown Plaza nor will i do again.The room was ok but the restaurant is a joke and the staff there not much better.We sat down ordered our meal and waited after a while we asked where it was as other diners were served before us they said they would look into it. After waiting over an hour we asked again same reply by then the staff would steer clear of our table and attend to everyone else out of either fear of what would be said or embrassment. 1hr 40 mins later we walked along with other diners that had been waiting.I ended up eating at a Jack in the box down the street which is where the so called chef should take a lesson on quick delivery of a meal!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Greatest . . Outdated, Neighborhood looked shady”
Reviews.Author: cootsChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel thru Hotwire for $53.00 per night. Price was right. Room was adequate, not great. No hairdryer in room. Had to ask maid for portable dryer. Place is definitely in need of remodeling. Location is off the expressway, but looks kind of questionable as far as the area of town. Rooms appeared to be clean. But after staying at a new Hampton Inn this was definitely disappointing. Pool area if just OK, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hoopoe01
Reviews.Content: The airport shuttle driver snarled at me for not tipping him after he didn't help me with my bags. The bedside lamp did not work. There was no place to hang a wet towel in the bathroom. The noise from the highway was horrendous, especially a truck backing up for fifteen minutes, with accompanying beeps. The printer in the business center was low on toner. The bed was fine, the room was clean enough, and the restaurant was okay but I won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby and pools -- small rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveler309
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza hotel has some very positive attributes. The lobby is beautiful, the pool areas are beautiful and the 99 Degree Lounge is youthful and modern and does a thriving business on weekend nights. The hotel is an excellent place to hold a conference or event. The event areas are spacious and well-kept. An event planner is available to assist with setting up the event and arranging for the catering. Despite the positive attributes, I have some reservations. The hotel was renovated in 2006 and whereas the lobby, conference rooms and pool areas are all colorful and updated; the renovation needed to extend to the bedrooms, which are more utilitarian than the lushness of the public rooms would lead you to expect. Additionally, the lobby area and the rooms surrounding the indoor pool are extremely humid. It is not that bad during the spring/fall/winter months, but it is dreadful in the summer. The pool also causes the lobby and public rooms to smell strongly of chlorine. Truth in advertising is always a desired quality when seeking a hotel in a city that you are not completely familiar with. However, the Crowne Plaza website is, shall we say, more enthusiastic about their property than is necessarily warranted. It is not what they say that is the problem; it is what they don’t say. For example, the website raves about their restaurants, but does not tell you that the main restaurant, La Cocina is only open 6am-1pm and serves only breakfast & lunch. The bar/lounge, 99 Degrees serves dinner, but it is mainly pub food and is only open 4pm-10pm. There is a complimentary shuttle that is available for a 5-mile radius, but it only runs 7am-10pm and you are required to wait as long as it takes in order to use it. The closest golf course is outside of the 5-mile complimentary shuttle range and is only a 9-hole course and driving range. Again, it is the omissions that are the problem, so be sure to do your due diligence.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: rookie00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights and loved the place. Exterior looks like it was designed and painted by kids, but the inside is very nice. The room was a fair size, the bed was huge and comfy and i recommend the rooms with an outside balcony, not an inside one; since fresh air is nice and humidity is not. The breakfast area is large and the food is excellent. Best scrambled eggs I`ve ever had! The restaurant is very nice and the waiter was very good. The young bartender was basically ignorant and a chip on his shoulder; but that could be because he`s young and figures he`s God`s gift to women. A friend/colleague and i decided to go out for a beer and didn`t know where to go. The front desk clerk made arrangements to drive us to a place when she got off work (about fifteen minutes from punch out time) and she dropped us off without taking any money from us. When we got there we the place was closed so we called the hotel to tell them. They immediately sent out the Plaza Van to get us. The clerk who came to get us took the long way back (or so it seemed) and we got to see an interesting part of Phoenix. Excellent, excellent, excellent customer service. My family is planning our bi-annual trip to Florida this coming winter and i think i have her convinced that we need to visit Phoenix as a family instead. I wouldn`t dream of staying anywhere else, even at a higher rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: 1julieg
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay recently during the Thanksgiving holiday weekend. We had the "run of the hotel", as there weren't many guests. Maybe it was due to the holiday. Anyhow, we were happy with our clean room, guest services, the pools, gym and complimentary buffet breakfast. We chose to stay at the Crown Plaza hotel due to it having an indoor pool as the weather was too cold to swim outside (or so we thought). The indoor pool/spa temperatures were just right, and to our surprise, the outdoor pool was even warmer for us to swim in! The hotel is right off the freeway for easy access. The breakfast buffet was pleasant with choice of eggs, potatoes, waffles/pancakes, fruit, cereals, meats and pastries. The only downside was the coffee was the least to be desired. Luckily there is a coffee bar that serves Starbucks coffee. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the indoor pool, which was a little noisy at night when putting our younger children to bed...noise lasted till about 10pm with late evening swimmers. If you are looking for a more quiet room, it might be better to get a room not facing the indoor pool. The hotel is close to many great restaurants. We chose to eat at Papadaux, an excellent seafood restaurant. I highly recommend trying if you stay at this hotel. If we go back, we will certainly return to the Crown Plaza. I gave it 4 out of 5 stars due to the fact the front desk kept forgetting to give us our breakfast buffet tickets, which was a bit irritating.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Beachfourus
Reviews.Content: I was having problems at the airport getting the car I wanted and finally the gave me what I ordered. I know when I got to the hotel I was not in the best of moods and I think Patti at the front dest could see that. She was absolutely amazing from the time I arrived till I checked out. I just want to say that all the staff was wonderful. Great Stay and Service.

Reviews.Title: “worst”
Reviews.Author: badandgood
Reviews.Content: i walked in right had problems service sucked front desk m ngr rude and no anwers went to room no internet than was told service tech would be up there he got there and told me to call wayport as i called wayport there internet provider phone line was destorded. service tech still in room i ask him well [CANT HERE HIM] TECH RESPONSE NOT MY PROBLEM.Well my response is yea it is cause im your guest i payed money for the room that advertises the internet. called front desk we can get you another room no im in hurry to another destanation i dont want to be tied up my time with fixing internet right now ill deal with this when i get back so i get back call way port for one hour i deal with way port tech and no sulution. On net problem agian conversasion is choppy i no theproblem it the phone line done with internet and go to swimming pool were swimming and low and behold were back in the room to find i have fault shower handle and it goes on there is more out let spark as go to plug in i stop no im worried i might have fire in my room spark are caused buy bad grounding the wireing so i go outside to check around 4 trays that were delverd in the morning were still there at 900 pm i arived at 100 pm and on my way out in the morning low and behold trays still out there 1200 same trays and same wine glass.that a total of 16 hours trays wih food on it sill mee bread ad of salad

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: tucsoncop
Reviews.Content: Once again, I was initially weary seeing other's reviews of this hotel. Once again, I should have known that many having reviewed this hotel, were slightly off the mark. I stayed at the Phoenix Crowne Plaza for one week for a business trip. I booked my room on Priceline.com for $33.00 a day. Let me repeat that folks...$33.00 a day!!! What a deal! Upon arriving, I was afraid I was going to be stuck in a double room. At 6'2, that isn't always the most comfortable situation. When I explained this to the front desk staff, she told me about renovations going on and not having many rooms. I was a little taken back because there were maybe 8 cars in the parking lot. I made nice with the clerk, smiled and what do you know, an upgraded room! Not that the clerk was initially nasty, but just needed some warming up with compliments, etc. After that, every person from the housekeeping staff, to the bartender to the concierge were amazing. Never a problem at all with the room. Decor: The outside looks as if it had been recently remodeled. New paint, and it looked pretty nice. Inside looked the same way. Very nice remodel. I walked to the conference center to take a look and more of the same. Very nice, clean and no problems. The bar was extremely clean, well kept and comfortable. There was an outdoor and indoor pool, neither of which I used, but they seemed to both be nice places to visit. The hallways of the interior section of the hotel seemed a little dingy. Not to say they weren't up to the standards of a 3 star hotel, but if I had to ding them on anything, I would have to put it with the hallways. Dark, carpets seemed a little worn and just something about the feel of them. Again, nothing to distract anyone from staying here. Room: I stayed in a King room. The bathroom was huge with nice shampoos and soaps. Nothing like a 5 star resort, but very acceptable for the 3 star rating. Towels weren't new, but they weren't ripped, torn or worn. The bedding was extremely comfortable and although I don't sleep well in hotels, it was better than I was expecting. The television was nice and inside of an armoire that pulled out. Not a lot of storage space if you are the type who likes to unpack into the furniture, but it was comfortable in the room. The a/c was freezing if you want it that way and the room was exceptionally clean. The room had a mini fridge and when I say mini, i mean mini. Tiny actually, but hey...I had a cooler and was fine. Also, I think the hotel advertises wireless internet everywhere, but this was not the case. Wireless is only available in the lobby and common areas. In the room, they will bring you a LAN cord, but the internet there is very slow, so don't expect DSL or cable speeds. It was acceptable for checking email though. Overall, this hotel was great. The only thing I didn't like was the area. I used to live in Phoenix and I'm amazed that this area has kind of went down the drain. The Metrocenter mall up the street is pretty dumpy, with only several restaurants available. Its not Scottsdale that's for sure. That being said, I had none of the problems with car break ins, or the such. I think this happens EVERYWHERE if you want my opinion. If you want a great deal, I would definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: birdog28
Reviews.Content: They virtually insist on Valet parking your car.... Personally I hate this... I'm particular about my cars, and it is another security leak issue. Arrival area is trafic congested and I find it better to check in during daylight hours or be very alert. Rooms are nicely done but not large. Breakfast buffet was nearly giveaway quality. Location is the key attraction to this hotel if you have itinerary right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Been there, done that”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianChick
Reviews.Content: Okay, we've stayed here 3 times now and mostly b/c I have been too lazy to look for any other place but no more. This last time with the moist, humid air in the hotel from the pool and the air conditioner barely working and the horrilbe double beds (I mean, who does double beds instead of queen sized beds anymore-honestly!). This was the last time. I always make the reservations from the hotel website to get points and the price you pay is not worth what you get. With the economy the way it is, I am asking for more now for what I usually pay and the places that will endure will have to innovate.

Reviews.Title: “Once grand, now mediocre. Doesn't live up to it's name”
Reviews.Author: jsdive
Reviews.Content: I usually associate this hotel chain with upscale properties. Sadly, this hotel has passed it's prime. the carpets are DIRTY, and threadbare in places. (There was a patch under the desk in our room that was actually coming unsewn). the poor maintence man had to come to our room three times for a clogged toilet. (I know: don't say it!) The ice machines on 3 of the 4 floors were not working. The chrome on the fixtures in the bathroom was coming off. We booked our room through Hotwire, and the price we paid through it was just about right or even a little too much. They count on special events to fill the place. when we were there there was a soccer tournament nearby. can you imagine what that was like?! Wisely, the kids were banned from certain floors. Now the good: nice personnel In short: I'd opt for other places nearby which are much nicer, newer and cheaper. Look for this Crown Plaza to be removed from the Crown Plaza line of hotels soon. It simply doesn't measure up to their high standards

Reviews.Title: “Awful Odor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are at all sensitive to odors from cleaning chemicals, oldc arpet , chlorine, you won't want to stay in this hotel. My husband and I stayed here several years ago, and it was very nice. The hotel is tauted as being upgraded, yet the internet connection is really slow, the ac/heating unit is loud, and the bar area is dismal. The odor was so offensive, I wanted to leave in the middle of the night. Because I'm on business until tomorrow, I changed hotels to the Courtyard Marriott. I will say, however, that the Crowne Plaza desk manager was very courteous and, without hesitation, accommodated my request to not be charged for the time I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Phoenix hotel from February 15, 2009 to February 18, 2009 in room 155. There were some minor issues, but overall I was pleased with my stay. The hotel was pretty easy to get to from the airport, exit 208 off I-17 North. Check-in only took about 2 minutes. The staff of the hotel was very friendly. They always made sure to say hello as we entered the hotel. The room was of average size and the bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. The room décor seemed a bit dated and there were some signs of age. The bathroom was of average size with a decent shower and good water pressure. Complimentary soaps, lotions, and shampoos were replaced every day. They had a CD player and complimentary sleep CD, sleep mask, and ear plugs. There was a vanity mirror and hair dryer attached to the wall. The television had a decent selection of channels and movies to purchase. There was a nice work desk with a comfy leather chair. The grounds of the hotel were very aesthetically pleasing and clean. There was a nice outdoor pool area we did not use. We did order room service on two occasions. The food was very good, served quickly, and reasonably priced. There were plenty of parking spaces available. The hotel was located very close to a number of restaurants and a shopping mall across the highway. The AC worked great. There were some minor issues with my stay that prevent me from giving a 5 circle review. First, the hot tub was not hot, it was only very warm. The jets/bubbles in the hot tub very not very strong either. The ceilings in the hotel hallways and bathrooms were very low. I’m very tall and a few more inches and I would have had to duck everywhere I walked. They did have a business center, but the internet stations were not free. You had to pay 35 cents a minute. That was disappointing considering that most hotels I’ve stayed at have at least a few free internet stations. One of the phones in our room did not work and the door to the room did not close easily. A mini-fridge would have been nice. Tip: When you stay here you’ll either get a room with a balcony inside facing the indoor pool or a balcony room facing the parking lot/street. The rooms facing outside may be quieter as you will not have to hear kids playing in the pool or smell the chlorine. However, the pool area was pretty empty and quiet the entire time I was there. I knew I wasn’t staying at the Four Seasons, but I was getting a very good deal on a decent hotel. Overall, I was very pleased with my accommodations and the very comfortable bed was the highlight of the stay. Marc T. Hardekopf

Reviews.Title: “Odd hotel...mostly good.”
Reviews.Author: Kenbob
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very odd public spaces. Most rooms surround an inner courtyard containing an indoor pool. It resembles a motel more than a first-class hotel. My room was mostly good. A recent refurbishment has led them to replace a number of things but certainly not all of them. My room for example, had a good and what seemd like new bed, new wallpaper but the original carpet and furniture (a bit worn). The bathroom was almost competely new except for old and broken faucets on the sink and a drop ceiling with stains from an apparent water leak. The price I paid was excellent through Priceline and was worth it. One further caution.....no wireless internet and the wired service that they do have is somewhat faulty. All in all.....the feel of an upgraded Holiday Inn but certainly not 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Southwest Style Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: 2_Travel_Smart
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful overall ambiance and the restaurant served wonderful food. We have stayed for conferences and to visit family in Phoenix. The property has great amenities and the rooms are very nice. However it does have a few problems. We have been there a number of times and have had a few problems registering and housekeeping gets a little behind. . A few times our rooms have not been ready and we have come into an unkempt room, but it was corrected and in general the staff was friendly about it. Also be careful to check the air conditioning when you get your room, as this seems to be a recurrent problem I have attended a few conferences at this hotel and a number of people had issues with this. Once you get checked into the room though the place gets high marks. The staff is friendly and helpful. The pools (particularly the indoor one with the waterfall) are wonderful and I specifically recall a function in the outdoor tent where the food was very good for a buffet. As I said the restaurant is wonderful. The sports bar theme of the bar in the evening is not really to my taste though my girlfriend's brother loved it, and the other area has limited hours and the ambiance is not consistent with the hotel. I hope they change this, as the food is wonderful. We opted for room service and take out because we enjoy the food but not the din of the restaurant. That said we really enjoyed the waitresses when we did eat in the restaurant. As a matter of a fact my girlfriend’s sister went into labor there so this hotel is a bit of family history now. Overall I would give this hotel high marks. The few service break downs are countered by the ambiance, good food, and friendliness the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: KATSanClemente
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Phoenix for two nights. The staff was very friendly and welcoming and the room was very comfortable and overlooked the indoor pool area which is attractively decorated. The next morning my daughter enjoyed swimming in the pool and soaking in the spa. Shortly after we checked in and got in our room our phone rang, It was Jay from the front desk who asked if everything was okay with our room. Then he proceeded to let me know that I had left my purse on the floor in front of the registration counter (actually my daughter did), so I quickly replied I would be right down to get it. If he had not been so quick to see the purse and let us know, my daughter could have lost the purse and all her credit cards. We really appreciated Jay's quick response. We will stay at the hotel the next time we are in the area, and will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelilady
Reviews.Content: Being northerners my husband and I loved the colorful southwest appeal of this hotel. After a long drive the friendly and efficient front staff was a delight. They were also good about directions to restaurants and sights. Our room was comfortable and clean and the bed good. We found the room larger than most hotel rooms. It was especially nice to have an outdoor and indoor pool - worked well with the weather. The outdoor pool area was clean, colorful and relaxing. We took advantage of the breakfast buffet which was exceptional - the fresh fruit was very good and the coffee super! We have friend who will be visiting the Phoneix area this fall and have recommended the Crowne Plaza to them.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Accommodating, and Attentive...”
Reviews.Author: gambari
Reviews.Content: Despite a musty smell that permeated throughout the hallways of the fourth floor, this hotel was extremely comfortable, accommodating, and attentive to each of my needs. I arrived close to midnight and a staff member was there to great me and get me checked into my room within a ten-minute time frame. The king-sized bed was extremely comfortable and provided me with an excellent night's rest. Check out was a snap with the staff member taking less than five minutes to complete my transaction. Overall, this hotel impressed me and it would most definitely be high atop my list of places to stay for future visits!

Reviews.Title: “I would definetly Return”
Reviews.Author: luckyclovers
Reviews.Content: I booked this place at a great deal from priceline and than read some of the reviews here on tripadvisor so I was weary, but went ahead with my stay. I'm glad I did; the front desk supervisor was attentive and friendly, the room was clean and well appointed and room service was typical for a chain hotel. The pool did have the chlorine smell, but it's indoors so somewhat expected for the AZ heat.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripMan
Reviews.Content: First the good: The staff (except for manager, see below) is attentive, friendly and helpful. The bad: It is a horrible hotel. We paid for an "Executive Level" room -- 4th floor -- the only other perks are a bathrobe (whoopee) and a mini-fridge. Within the first hour we had maintenance at the room 3 times. The mini-fridge had a 1" hole in the center of the door where a lock had been. Maintenance fixed it by putting duct tape over the hole. Didn't cool. I insisted on a replacement. The shower did not drain. Not at all. Doesn't housekeeping ever notice this? The room was hot, thermostat showed 78 when we came in (3 pm on a Saturday, 100 degrees). I turned the dial to the lowest setting - 50 - to cool the room. One hour later it only read 77. I asked for another room, was shown 2 others, all of which were hot, didn't have mini-fridges and were on the inside corridor, not outside. I opted to stay where I was because: 1) The manager, Henry ?Nagle?, told me "They are working on the air conditioning." 2) The inside pool was so heavily chlorinated it reeked. The smell did dissipate over the week I was there but it was nauseating for the weekend. Inside rooms had balconies that opened to the inside pool but were steamy (from the pool) and dark. Our hot room at least had an outside balcony. The halls and the elevator are NOT airconditioned below 80, due to the inside pool. This, in Phoenix, in August. You walk in from the outside 100+ heat to a lovely cool reception area, then through doors to a hot hallway, a hot elevator, and into a humid, warm room. Not nice. On Saturday night I found another maintenance man, complained about the hot room again, he told me "Management wants it at this temperature, I can't change it." I found the manager again, he said, "Oh no, not so, we are working on it, that's wrong." By Monday the room temp averaged about 74 even though we had it running constantly on "Max Cool" and dialed to 50. It stayed that way all week. Always warm and humid. Why didn't we move? We were there for a group meeting. And we heard MANY complaints about hot rooms on the east side of the hotel where we were. We figured we just had to put up with it, as we were lucky to have a room with an outside balcony HOWEVER.....on the following Saturday when we began packing to leave, the room got up to 78 again. On another floor I stopped by to see a friend, saw a housekeeper wiping the sweat off her face and asked her, "Why is this hotel so hot?" She ever so politely said, "They are working on it." I had an inspiration -- I took a $20 bill out of my purse, held it up and asked her again, "Why is this hotel so hot?" She took the $20 and said, "The manager insists on raising the temperature level every weekend. We hate it, it's horrible here on the weekends. And he knows the ducts on the east side don't work, he's known for months." The gift shop in the hotel doesn't take credit cards -- "Management hasn't hooked us up yet." Me: How long have you been here? Answer: 3 years. Avoid this hotel, nice staff people don't make up for a poorly maintained, shabby facility with a deceitful manager.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: barcodetech
Reviews.Content: Hotel is advertised as a non-smoking facility. Good idea, but instead of putting up signs bragging you are non-smoking, I would suggest replacing carpeting, drapes, or anything else that would hold smoke smell. (room and floor obviously allowed smoking before, besides the smell, there were cigarette burns in the carpet) Shower ceiling was rusty. The hotel has a problem with their magnetic stripe cards. I had to return to the front desk 4 times to get them reactivated. Most of the time I could not get in the doors from the parking lot. Housekeeping is a joke. On the first day, the maid knocked loudly on the door despite there being a Do Not Disturb sign on the door. Second day she neglected to leave any towels, and the third day, no room service was done at all despite me having left at 10am and dutifully removing the Do Not Disturb sign. Upon coming back to my room the same day, the room next to me obviously had toilet troubles. There was a fan, and a used plunger outside the door, along with various cups and utensils along the hall. Nobody wants to look at this! Clean it up! It looked like skid row. I come to Phoenix monthly, and will refuse to be booked here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: travelfille
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was awful. On the evening my colleage and I checked in, a gentleman at the desk was reporting that the room he had been assigned to already had someone in it. Red flag #1. After checking into our own rooms, I found that the heat in my room didn't work and there was someone else's hair in the tub. I ordered room service only to find that there was a hair on the tray and no spoon for me to eat my soup with. There was also a hair on one of the washcloths and I don't want to get into what kind of hair it was. My colleage found that her room contained a half eaten box of Oreos, 4 diet cokes, several bottles of water that were of varying brands. One of the bottles of water was half empty. When she showered the next morning, she found that one of the towels had been hung up wet. We're still not sure whether someone was just showering in her room before she arrived or whether they never let the towels dry after being washed. We reported these problems to the front desk. I'm not sure if it was because we were "nice" about complaining or what, but there were no offers to give us a free night or anything else. As a matter of fact, there wasn't really an apology. I believe the front desk supervisor just said, "Oh, that's the not way its supposed to be." Needless to say, I'm disappointed. I was also rather disgusted. If those are the things we could see, what kinds of things were not visible? Anyway, we switched to another hotel after the second night of madness (i.e. the hair was never taken out of the tub and the heating was fixed, but cranked to 85 so my room felt like a sauna). Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: snails
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently on a business trip which included Washington and Disney World, Orlando. Of all the hotels I stayed in, this was by far the best value for money. I found the front desk staff friendly and helpful, the bedrooms clean and well equipped, the bed very comfortable and the general hotel areas very nice. The indoor pool and glass lift was very classy. A nice touch was the CD with bed-time music that was left on the bed. I can recommended this hotel and will certainly be back! Johan van Zyl South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 24 hours in advance on priceline and got a GREAT deal - $45! The room was cool and clean. there's an indoor pool in the lobby with a waterfall. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the last two years and have been fairly satisfied. I encountered a few issues with this stay and my last two stays that makes me never want to stay here again. First of all they have two different kinds of beds in the hotel and if you happen to be unfortunate as I was these last couple of stays and get the öld beds then you are in for a terrible nights sleep. They claim they replaced all of the mattresses a few years ago but that is simply not true. It felt like I was sleeping on a concrete slab! The other issue was that there were bugs in my room. One was even under the covers in the bed. I am not sure what kind they are but I was really upset since I noticed them on my last night so I had been sleeping with them for three prior nights. The hotel is very humid and really not in the best area although I have never had any issues with safety there. The bugs were too much!

Reviews.Title: “robbed twice beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a hard time finding a hotel since all hotels in the area were full and we thought we could save a few dollars at the crowne plaza instead of staying at the higher price resort which were twice the price. first let me tell you are first experience with crowne plaza in phoenix off of peoria . we stayed the night in 2004 . I woke up to find that my vehicle was robbed and vandalized , it was parked in front of the lobby under the parking lot lights every thing was stolen from my vehicle. .he next time i stayed was march 2006 , giving crowne plaza a chance. Wrong idea i woke up and went to my truck , opened the door and tried to put the key in the ignition . The ignition was torn to shreds and the passenger door lock was missing. Management claims the have security. Bell man said the night before a vehicle was stolen. there are no security cameras and to tell the truth it must be an inside job. BEWARE. find a better neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: KSGreer
Reviews.Content: This hotel we found to be clean, well-staffed, and convenient as it is located right near the freeway. I think the three-star rating is reasonable, as it was a nice hotel but nothing above average. Nicely decorated, and the room was well-furnished but small. There is some noticeable wear and tear, all minor, that comes from being an older and non-luxury hotel. Inexplicably there was no phone book in our room. The bed was firm but comfortable enough for sleep, with lots of pillows, and we experienced none of the noise problems that other guests have complained of (aside from usual pool noise before 9pm or so). Had no experience with the internet, but the restaurant had excellent breakfasts. Not the cheapest, but the food was fresh and quite delectable. Should we return we'd probably prefer to stay in nearby Scottsdale, as we spent more time there, but for a traveler looking for a reasonably priced, decent hotel in the city this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “I'm here now on business but it's will be my last stay here.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The noise on the I-17 facing rooms provokes insanity. I believe locals must use that stretch of interstate as a drag strip...and on a Monday night too. Every third vehicle in Arizona has no muffler, based upon my experience. Staff was responsive and moved me to an internal pool-facing room which was quiet....until the AC came on and there was a contiuous rattle of the fan motor. The hotel is old, carpet is worn and lumpy, beds are extra firm and not particularly comfortable. Hi-speed access is slowwwwww, on the order of 56K modem slow. Breakfast buffet is complimentary and is pretty good if you arrive early to breakfast. Overall, I am not satisfied. You can do better with the Four Point Sheraton. If you are staying in this area, there are several Marriots (Courtyard, Springhill Suites, Residence Inn) and my preference for future visits is the Sheraton Four Points about 1 mile from here.

Reviews.Title: “Found it to be a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: matt_tx00
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some family members for one night in mid January 2006 on the way from the Phoenix airport. I have to admit first off that we didn't stay here long - we got in late (around midnight) and left fairly early the next morning. The location is fine - along I-17 about 15 miles north of downtown Phoenix. The hotel lobby is very nice - a design that matches well with the desert outside. For a hotel like the Crowne Plaza, the room was just average I thought. However, the beds were very comfortable. The one major problem we had while staying here was with the AC/heater - we couldn't get the heater to shut off all night even though we had the temperature set correctly. So the room was way too hot. I couldn't imagine what it would be like if you had a similar problem staying here during Phoenix's summer. There's not really much near this hotel - we had to drive quite a ways to find a decent restaurant or even a gas station. That seems to be what Phoenix is like in general. I am a member of the Priority Club, and they gave me passes for two free happy hour drinks, and a pass for a free breakfast buffet. Never did take a chance on either of these though. The bar in the lobby (99 degrees) looked pretty nice, so I'm thinking the happy hour is probably pretty well done here. We paid $127 for our stay here for one night. I'm confident that you could find equally nice in Phoenix for less than this.

Reviews.Title: “A Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. This was my first trip to Phoenix and I chose this hotel because I got a really nice discounted rate. And I must say, this hotel is EXCELLENT!!! I LOVED, LOVED, LOVED, this hotel!! I checked in on a Saturday and checked out on Wednesday and loved every minute. The decor is beautiful. The cleanliness of the hotel was definitely top notch. And the entire staff definitely deserved an A plus all around. They were very friendly, helpful, and extremely attentive to all of my needs. My room faced the indoor swimming pool, and I heard no noise from the pool at all. They have an indoor and outdoor pool and whirlpool. I was able to test out the outdoor whirlpool, and despite it being 95 degrees out, I enjoyed it. The hot breakfast buffet was worth every penny. The location of the hotel couldn't be better either. There's lots of shopping 5 minutes away, and there was a beautiful scenic park 10 minutes away where I took some lovely photos of the mountains. So if you're looking for something better than the average hotel, and not as pricey as those 5 star ones (but just as nice), you must stay here. You will not be diappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Cup Archery Tournament”
Reviews.Author: CactusPatch
Reviews.Content: The Arizona State Archery Association hosts the Arizona Cup Olympic and International style Archery Tournament every year. The archers told us a few years ago that when they travel to compete they want to stay at a place where they can be comfortable and focus on the tournament. We began working with the Crowne Plaza Metro Center Phoenix in 2003 and have received thanks from the archers every year for naming the CP as the tournament hotel. They appreciate the nice breakfast, elegant high fashion public spaces that still have a southwestern feel and the indoor and outdoor pool. The rooms with two queen size beds are just the right size. The property is the only hotel in the North Phoenix area that offers an elegant environment without destination hotel prices. It is the perfect balance between those that need tour support and those that are independent travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: RANDY823
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this great Hotel for two nights. (Sat. and Sunday) Overall, this is one of the best Hotel experiences I have ever had. My Room had the Indoor Pool just outside my front door and the outdoor Pool was a sliding glass door away, out of the other side of my Room. It was the best of the best. The staff was there to take care of any need I had. Always a smile and a thank you. Who could ask for more? Each guest receives a ticket for two free drinks at the inhouse Bar and Grill. The food was great and the big screen made watching sports a pleasure. Each morning you will enjoy the breakfast buffett, this is also free! Although there is a charge for hot items. The best part of this stay was the room rate. In the past, I stayed at Hotels with similar features and paid "TWICE" the rate I paid at the Crown Plaza. If you want a great place to stay that is good for kids and business people alike, this "IS" the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yes! Yes! Did I Say Yes?!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The inviting lobby of the Crowne Plaza in Phoenix, Arizona reminded me of home; vibrant colors and personality. Loved the lobby's decor and "big" energy; a courageous and refreshing departure from Phoenix's sand-colored everything. The bar/lounge area was suitably cozy with good food and big screen TV. No, we didn't sleep in the lobby or on the bar's pool table. Our non-smoking room was CLEAN, SPACIOUS and had NO ODORS. Thank God. Have to admit, I was nervous booking a hotel I'd never stayed at before but Hotwire did us right this time. And the fact that the bartender knew how to make a REAL cosmopolitan?! Nice. What I applaud this hotel for mostly though....and VALUE in any hotel......is STAFF. A big, fat 10 goes to the lobby and hospitality staff at the Crowne Plaza, Phoenix! Every hotel has its problems but what separates the average from the commendable is the willingness of its staff to make your stay, in the end, remembered as comfortable and pleasant. When the data port in our room wasn't working, within 10 minutes of our call, 2 service technicians arrived to fix it. When they couldn't, the hospitality staff invited us into their office where we were told to use their computer as long as we liked. We had come to Phoenix to house hunt so the internet was critical. Even though they were right in the middle of scheduling someone's wedding reception, they turned to us and said, "No problem. Do you need the printer too?" Sweet. We had booked a room overlooking the inside pool. Our mistake; nice pool.....big noise. We asked to change rooms for the second night and the desk clerk said, "Let's upgrade that room for you." By now, I'm starting to think about writing a review for this place. What else? ATM in the lobby, fitness center, laundry, computer room and a cute little sleep pouch with a "relaxation" CD in it (obviously, for the sleep-challenged people in the pool rooms but, nonetheless, a nice touch.) Staff smiles abounded, house-keeping ladies did their job well and we looked forward to returning to the hotel after long days looking at pigeon infested houses! (Before you decide to move to Phoenix, do your homework. No matter what the real estate agents and residents say, (like "WHAT PIGEONS?"), this place has a problem.) I digressed. This is supposed to be about the hotel. Anyway....... Yes, stay at the Crowne Plaza. If comfort, hospitality and cleanliness matter, no disappointments here. When we visit Phoenix again (but NOT to buy a coop), we will certainly consider the Crowne! HAPPY TRAVELS! D

Reviews.Title: “Over Their Heads....”
Reviews.Author: tmalone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crown Plaza for 4 nights beginning March 24, 2004. They had overbooked the hotel...were asking guests to move to another property and then return to the CP the next day. They finally gave us a double bed room that was very substandard...smelly pillows, shower that dribbled water...noisy ac...and smelled like smoke (even though it was supposed to be non-smoking). The promise was they would move us to a "king/non-smoking room the next day. After a long and frustrating conversation,the next morning, we ended up with a king/smoking room (only option available). They called our room later in the day and asked "what are you doing in that room, you are not registered guests". Finally was able to show them that we were registered and had switched rooms at their direction. As we were having guests over one afternoon, we asked to have our room cleaned by noon...it was finally cleaned at 3:30!! One of the most challenging stays we have ever had...anywhere. In their defense, they were extremely busy, but they certainly were "over their heads" and openly admitted it. I would avoid this property during the busy tourist season.

Reviews.Title: “An average Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, I've stayed at many Crowne Plaza hotels. This particular hotel, while not bad, is certainly not the finest Crowne Plaza has to offer. The large atrium section is strangely devoid of any character, as if they haven't decided what motif to go with yet. Many of the large planters in the atrium are empty, and with the dark lighting it gives the hotel an impersonal, cavernous feel. Plus, the indoor pool is right in the center of the atrium, so forget about peace and quiet until about 9pm. The rooms themselves are okay, about the same as your average Holiday Inn. I would stay here as an alternative to a Holiday Inn or similar, but if you are looking for something nicer, I suggest one of the nearby Hiltons or Marriotts.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 2532 W. Peoria Avenue, Phoenix, AZ 85029
